alert.note: Alert for South End of the Upper Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 22 at 8:18AM PDT until October 22 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. Expect gusts as high as 75 mph in highest elevations. * WHERE...South End of the Upper Sierra, Piute Walker Basin, Tehachapi, Indian Wells Valley, Mojave Desert Slopes and Mojave Desert. * WHEN...From 8 AM to 11 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Highways impacted include, but are not limited to, State Route 178, State Route 14, State Route 58 and US 395.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: South End of the Upper Sierra
